description: A striking 130-meter-high architectural landmark featuring 33 aluminum letters of the Georgian alphabet, each 4 meters tall, arranged in two helical bands resembling a DNA double helix. Designed by architect Alberto Domingo Cabo and completed in 2011, it symbolizes how the Georgian language unites the Georgian people, combining cultural heritage with modern design.
